segment.source: Introduction to WPR
segment.target: Introduction to WPR

segment.source: Introduction to WPR
segment.target: Introduction to WPR

segment.source: Introduction to WPR
segment.target: Introduction to WPR

segment.source: Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) is a tool that extends Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) and provides detailed recordings of system and application behavior and resource usage.
segment.target: Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) is a tool that extends Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) and provides detailed recordings of system and application behavior and resource usage.

segment.source: You can use WPR together with Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) to investigate particular areas of performance and to gain an overall understanding of resource consumption.
segment.target: You can use WPR together with Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) to investigate particular areas of performance and to gain an overall understanding of resource consumption.

segment.source: WPR and WPA enable development and IT professionals to proactively identify and resolve performance issues.
segment.target: WPR and WPA enable development and IT professionals to proactively identify and resolve performance issues.

segment.source: WPR requires Windows 7 or later version operating system.
segment.target: WPR requires Windows 7 or later version operating system.

segment.source: WPR User Interface
segment.target: WPR User Interface

segment.source: The WPR user interface (UI) makes it simple to generate a recording by using built-in recording profiles to analyze CPU usage, power issues, poor system or application performance, or other performance issues.
segment.target: The WPR user interface (UI) makes it simple to generate a recording by using built-in recording profiles to analyze CPU usage, power issues, poor system or application performance, or other performance issues.

segment.source: Authoring Custom Recording Profiles
segment.target: Authoring Custom Recording Profiles

segment.source: You can author custom profiles in XML and add them to WPR.
segment.target: You can author custom profiles in XML and add them to WPR.

segment.source: You can use custom profiles alone or together with built-in profiles or to make specialized recordings that are designed for any usage scenario.
segment.target: You can use custom profiles alone or together with built-in profiles or to make specialized recordings that are designed for any usage scenario.

segment.source: Logging to File or Memory
segment.target: Logging to File or Memory

segment.source: WPR can log events to either a file or to circular buffers in memory.
segment.target: WPR can log events to either a file or to circular buffers in memory.

segment.source: We recommend that you log to file for finite events that can be predicted, such as application start-up or power usage when the computer emerges from a sleep state.
segment.target: We recommend that you log to file for finite events that can be predicted, such as application start-up or power usage when the computer emerges from a sleep state.

segment.source: File logging is the only logging mode that is available to measure events through on/off transitions.
segment.target: File logging is the only logging mode that is available to measure events through on/off transitions.

segment.source: We recommend that you log to memory for unpredictable events.
segment.target: We recommend that you log to memory for unpredictable events.

segment.source: You can run these recordings for long periods of time without consuming finite memory resources.
segment.target: You can run these recordings for long periods of time without consuming finite memory resources.

segment.source: Detail Level
segment.target: Detail Level

segment.source: You can select the detail level that fits the scenario: either light or verbose.
segment.target: You can select the detail level that fits the scenario: either light or verbose.

segment.source: Light recordings carry less overhead and interfere less with the system (they are sometimes called "timing" recordings).
segment.target: Light recordings carry less overhead and interfere less with the system (they are sometimes called "timing" recordings).

segment.source: Verbose recordings are more useful for thorough analysis.
segment.target: Verbose recordings are more useful for thorough analysis.
